Class CyclingPortalImpl

java.lang.Object
cycling.CyclingPortalImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
CyclingPortal, MiniCyclingPortal, Serializable
public class CyclingPortalImpl extends Object implements CyclingPortal
Implementor of the CyclingPortal interface.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Olly Johnson and Laith Al-Qudah

  • Method Details

    • validateTeamName

      private void validateTeamName(String name) throws IllegalNameException, InvalidNameException
      This helper method checks if the provided team name is valid. It ensures that the name is not null, not empty, does not exceed 30 characters, does not contain any whitespace, and is not already in use by another team.
      Parameters:
      name - The team name to be validated.
      Throws:
      IllegalNameException - If the team name already exists within the system.
      InvalidNameException - If the team name is null, empty, too long, or contains whitespace.

    • validateRaceName

      private void validateRaceName(String name) throws IllegalNameException, InvalidNameException
      This helper method verifies the validity of a race name. It checks for the name being non-null, non-empty, within a 30-character limit, free of whitespace, and ensures it is not already assigned to an existing race.
      Parameters:
      name - The race name to be validated.
      Throws:
      IllegalNameException - If the race name already exists within the system.
      InvalidNameException - If the race name is null, empty, exceeds the character limit, or contains whitespace.

    • validateId

      private void validateId(int[] idArray, int id) throws IDNotRecognisedException
      This helper method validates the existence of an ID within a provided array of IDs. It throws an exception if the ID is not found, indicating it is not recognized within the system.
      Parameters:
      idArray - An array of IDs to be searched.
      id - The ID to be validated against the array.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the ID is not present in the provided array.

    • getRaceIds

      public int[] getRaceIds()
      This implementation retrieves all race IDs currently stored in the system. It compiles these IDs into an array and returns it.
      Specified by:
      getRaceIds in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Returns:
      An array of all the race IDs.

    • createRace

      public int createRace(String name, String description) throws IllegalNameException, InvalidNameException
      This implementation creates a new race with the specified name and description. Upon successful creation, it assigns a unique ID to the race and stores it within the system.
      Specified by:
      createRace in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the new race.
      description - A brief description of the race.
      Returns:
      The unique ID assigned to the newly created race.
      Throws:
      IllegalNameException - If the race name provided is invalid, such as being empty or containing illegal characters.
      InvalidNameException - If the race name already exists within the system.

    • addStageToRace

      public int addStageToRace(int raceId, String stageName, String description, double length, LocalDateTime startTime, StageType type) throws IDNotRecognisedException, IllegalNameException, InvalidNameException, InvalidLengthException
      This implementation adds a new stage to an existing race. It requires a stage name, description, length, start time, and type. A unique ID is generated for the new stage.
      Specified by:
      addStageToRace in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      raceId - The ID of the race to which the stage will be added.
      stageName - The name of the stage.
      description - A description of the stage.
      length - The length of the stage in kilometers.
      startTime - The start time of the stage.
      type - The type of the stage (e.g., flat, mountain).
      Returns:
      The unique ID of the newly added stage.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the race ID does not correspond to any existing race.
      IllegalNameException - If the stage name provided is invalid.
      InvalidNameException - If the stage name is not unique within the race.
      InvalidLengthException - If the length provided for the stage is non-positive.

    • findStageById

      public Stage findStageById(int stageId) throws IDNotRecognisedException
      This helper method locates a stage by its ID across all races.
      Parameters:
      stageId - The ID of the stage to find.
      Returns:
      The stage object if found.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the stage ID does not match any stage in the system.

    • addCategorizedClimbToStage

      public int addCategorizedClimbToStage(int stageId, Double location, CheckpointType type, Double averageGradient, Double length) throws IDNotRecognisedException, InvalidLocationException, InvalidStageStateException, InvalidStageTypeException
      This implementation adds a categorized climb checkpoint to a stage.
      Specified by:
      addCategorizedClimbToStage in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      stageId - The ID of the stage where the climb is added.
      location - The location of the climb within the stage.
      type - The type of climb.
      averageGradient - The average gradient of the climb.
      length - The length of the climb.
      Returns:
      The ID of the newly added climb checkpoint.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the stage ID does not match any stage in the system.
      InvalidLocationException - If the location is not valid for the stage.
      InvalidStageStateException - If the stage is not in the correct state to add a checkpoint.
      InvalidStageTypeException - If the stage type does not allow for climbs.

    • addIntermediateSprintToStage

      public int addIntermediateSprintToStage(int stageId, double location) throws IDNotRecognisedException, InvalidLocationException, InvalidStageStateException, InvalidStageTypeException
      This implementation adds an intermediate sprint checkpoint to a stage.
      Specified by:
      addIntermediateSprintToStage in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      stageId - The ID of the stage where the sprint is added.
      location - The location of the sprint within the stage.
      Returns:
      The ID of the newly added sprint checkpoint.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the stage ID does not match any stage in the system.
      InvalidLocationException - If the location is out of stage bounds.
      InvalidStageStateException - If the stage is not in a state to add checkpoints.
      InvalidStageTypeException - If the stage type is not appropriate for sprints.

    • removeCheckpoint

      public void removeCheckpoint(int checkpointId) throws IDNotRecognisedException, InvalidStageStateException
      This implementation removes a checkpoint from a stage.
      Specified by:
      removeCheckpoint in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      checkpointId - The ID of the checkpoint to be removed.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the checkpoint ID is not recognised.
      InvalidStageStateException - If the stage is not in a correct state to remove a checkpoint.

    • concludeStagePreparation

      public void concludeStagePreparation(int stageId) throws IDNotRecognisedException, InvalidStageStateException
      This implementation finalizes the preparation of a stage by setting it to a state where it awaits results.
      Specified by:
      concludeStagePreparation in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      stageId - The ID of the stage to conclude preparation for.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the stage ID does not match any stage in the system.
      InvalidStageStateException - If the stage is "waiting for results".

    • createRider

      public int createRider(int teamId, String name, int yearOfBirth) throws IDNotRecognisedException, IllegalArgumentException
      This implementation adds a new rider to a team within the system.
      Specified by:
      createRider in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      teamId - The ID of the team to which the rider will be added.
      name - The name of the rider.
      yearOfBirth - The year of birth of the rider.
      Returns:

      Throws:

      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided name is null or the year of birth is earlier than 1900.

    • registerRiderResultsInStage

      public void registerRiderResultsInStage(int stageId, int riderId, LocalTime... checkpoints) throws IDNotRecognisedException, DuplicatedResultException, InvalidCheckpointTimesException, InvalidStageStateException
      This implementation registers the checkpoint times for a rider in a given stage. It updates the stage's results with the times provided, which include both checkpoint times and the total elapsed time for the rider in this particular stage.
      Specified by:
      registerRiderResultsInStage in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      stageId - The ID of the stage to which the results should be added.
      riderId - The ID of the rider whose results are being recorded.
      checkpoints - An array of LocalTime objects representing the rider's times at each checkpoint.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the stage or rider ID does not exist within the system.
      DuplicatedResultException - If a result for the given rider and stage already exists.
      InvalidCheckpointTimesException - If the number of times provided does not match the number of checkpoints in the stage.
      InvalidStageStateException - If the stage is not in a state that allows result registration.

    • getRiderResultsInStage

      public LocalTime[] getRiderResultsInStage(int stageId, int riderId) throws IDNotRecognisedException
      This implementation retrieves the times a rider recorded at each checkpoint in a stage.
      Specified by:
      getRiderResultsInStage in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      stageId - The ID of the stage being queried.
      riderId - The ID of the rider whose results are being requested.
      Returns:
      An array of LocalTime objects representing the times the rider passed each checkpoint.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the stage ID or rider ID does not match any stage or rider in the system.

    • getRiderAdjustedElapsedTimeInStage

      public LocalTime getRiderAdjustedElapsedTimeInStage(int stageId, int riderId) throws IDNotRecognisedException
      This implementation calculates a rider's adjusted elapsed time in a stage, accounting for various factors.
      Specified by:
      getRiderAdjustedElapsedTimeInStage in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      stageId - The ID of the stage being queried.
      riderId - The ID of the rider.
      Returns:
      The adjusted elapsed time of the rider in the stage.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the stage ID or rider ID does not match any stage or rider in the system.

    • eraseCyclingPortal

      public void eraseCyclingPortal()
      This implementation resets the cycling portal, clearing all stored data. All teams, races, riders, and checkpoints are removed, and ID counters are reset.
      Specified by:
      eraseCyclingPortal in interface MiniCyclingPortal

    • saveCyclingPortal

      public void saveCyclingPortal(String filename) throws IOException
      This implementation saves the current state of the cycling portal to a file. The portal's entire state is serialized and written to the specified file.
      Specified by:
      saveCyclingPortal in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      filename - The path and name of the file where data will be saved.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during writing to the file.

    • loadCyclingPortal

      public void loadCyclingPortal(String filename) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      This implementation loads the state of the cycling portal from a file. The state previously saved to the file is deserialized and used to populate the portal.
      Specified by:
      loadCyclingPortal in interface MiniCyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      filename - The path and name of the file from which to load the data.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during reading from the file.
      ClassNotFoundException - If the class of the serialized object cannot be found.

    • removeRaceByName

      public void removeRaceByName(String name) throws NameNotRecognisedException
      This implementation removes a race and all related data, including stages and results, from the system based on the race name. If the race name is found, the race and its associated data are completely deleted.
      Specified by:
      removeRaceByName in interface CyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the race to be removed.
      Throws:
      NameNotRecognisedException - If no race with the given name exists within the system.

    • getRidersGeneralClassificationRank

      public int[] getRidersGeneralClassificationRank(int raceId) throws IDNotRecognisedException
      This implementation determines the general classification rank of riders in a race.
      Specified by:
      getRidersGeneralClassificationRank in interface CyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      raceId - The ID of the race being queried.
      Returns:
      An array of rider IDs in the order of their general classification.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the race ID does not match any existing race.

    • getGeneralClassificationTimesInRace

    • getRidersPointClassificationRank

      public int[] getRidersPointClassificationRank(int raceId) throws IDNotRecognisedException
      This implementation retrieves the ranking of riders within a race based on the points classification. It considers the points each rider has accumulated throughout the race and orders them accordingly.
      Specified by:
      getRidersPointClassificationRank in interface CyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      raceId - The ID of the race for which the points classification is to be determined.
      Returns:
      An array of rider IDs ranked according to their total points in the race.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the race ID does not correspond to any existing race.

    • getRidersMountainPointClassificationRank

      public int[] getRidersMountainPointClassificationRank(int raceId) throws IDNotRecognisedException
      This implementation fetches the mountain points classification for riders within a race. Riders are ranked based on the total mountain points they have collected across all stages.
      Specified by:
      getRidersMountainPointClassificationRank in interface CyclingPortal
      Parameters:
      raceId - The ID of the race for which the mountain points classification is to be determined.
      Returns:
      An array of rider IDs ranked by their mountain points total.
      Throws:
      IDNotRecognisedException - If the race ID does not match any existing race.
